name: SelectorDropdownOverlay
description: The SelectorDropdownOverlay class is a specialized overlay component that provides a dropdown selection interface for users.
overview:
The SelectorDropdownOverlay class is a specialized overlay component that provides a dropdown selection interface for users. It displays a scrollable list of text choices that users can navigate through keyboard controls or mouse clicks. This overlay is commonly used for language selection, setting options, and other scenarios where users need to choose from a list of items.

Key Features:
- Scrollable list of text choices
- Keyboard navigation (arrow keys, enter/tab)
- Mouse click selection
- Visual selection highlighting
- Automatic scrollbar for long lists
- Click-outside-to-close functionality
- Customizable positioning and dimensions

constructors.signature: new SelectorDropdownOverlay(int x, int y, int width, int height, Collection<Text> choices, TextRenderer textRenderer, IOverlayParent parent, Consumer<Integer> onChoice)
constructors.description: Creates a new selector dropdown overlay with the specified parameters.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x coordinate of the overlay's top-left corner

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y coordinate of the overlay's top-left corner

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the overlay in pixels

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the overlay in pixels

parameters.name: choices
parameters.description: A collection of Text objects representing the selectable choices

parameters.name: textRenderer
parameters.description: The text renderer for drawing text elements

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The parent overlay container

parameters.name: onChoice
parameters.description: Callback function that accepts the index of the selected choice

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the overlay by creating buttons for each choice and setting up the scrollbar if needed. This method is called automatically when the overlay is opened.

methods.name: setSelected
methods.description: Sets the currently selected choice by index and updates the visual highlighting.

parameters.name: sel
parameters.description: The index of the choice to select. Use -1 for no selection.

methods.name: onScroll
methods.description: Handles scrolling functionality by updating the visibility and positions of choice buttons based on the current scroll position.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The current scroll page offset

methods.name: onClick
methods.signature: onClick(double mouseX, double mouseY, int button)
methods.description: Handles mouse click events. Closes the overlay if the click occurs outside the overlay bounds.

parameters.name: mouseX
parameters.description: The x coordinate of the mouse click

parameters.name: mouseY
parameters.description: The y coordinate of the mouse click

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: The mouse button that was clicked

examples:
// This is typically called internally by the GUI system
overlay.onClick(100, 50, 0); // Left click at position (100, 50)

methods.name: keyPressed
methods.signature: keyPressed(int keyCode, int scanCode, int modifiers)
methods.description: Handles keyboard input for navigation and selection. Returns true if the key was handled, false otherwise.

parameters.name: keyCode
parameters.description: The GLFW key code

parameters.name: scanCode
parameters.description: The platform-specific scan code

parameters.name: modifiers
parameters.description: Modifier key flags

examples:
// Simulate keyboard input
overlay.keyPressed(265, 0, 0); // Up arrow
overlay.keyPressed(264, 0, 0); // Down arrow
overlay.keyPressed(257, 0, 0); // Enter key

methods.name: render
methods.signature: render(DrawContext drawContext, int mouseX, int mouseY, float delta)
methods.description: Renders the overlay including background, buttons, and scrollbar.

parameters.name: drawContext
parameters.description: The drawing context for rendering

parameters.name: mouseX
parameters.description: Current mouse x position

parameters.name: mouseY
parameters.description: Current mouse y position

parameters.name: delta
parameters.description: Delta time for animations

examples:
// This is typically called automatically each frame
overlay.render(drawContext, mouseX, mouseY, delta);

methods.name: renderBackground
methods.description: Renders the overlay background with borders. Inherited from OverlayContainer.

parameters.name: drawContext
parameters.description: The drawing context for rendering

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the overlay and returns control to the parent container.
